author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump is offering clemency to the co-founder of a notorious Chicago gang, a rap artist and a music executive in the latest use of his pardon and commutation powers, according to a White House official.
title: Rapper NBA YoungBoy, Ex-Chicago Gang Leader Win Trump Clemency

author: Alastair Gale, Mari Kiyohara
description: Japan is stepping up efforts to deter China’s military ambitions in the Asia-Pacific as Tokyo and other US partners seek clarity from the Trump administration about its plans to counter Beijing’s power in the region.
title: Japan Expands Military Push Against China With US Stand in Doubt

author: Henrique Almeida
description: During Portugal’s recent election campaign, far-right Chega leader Andre Ventura argued that the two centrist parties that have ruled the nation for half a century have failed to increase living standards, control immigration and end systemic corruption.
title: Portugal’s Far-Right Chega Shatters 50-Year Two Party Dominance

author: Priscila Azevedo Rocha
description: The UK is fast-tracking the approval process for new reservoirs — the first in 30 years — as it seeks to secure water supplies for housing projects.
title: UK to Fast-Track First New Reservoirs as Water-Supply Risks Loom

author: Mark Chediak
description: The Trump Administration terminated a $3 billion loan guarantee awarded to Sunnova Energy Intentional Inc. after the solar company told officials it no longer intended to tap into the facility.
title: Trump Administration Cancels $3 Billion Loan to Troubled Sunnova Energy

author: Ryan Chua
description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced visa restrictions on foreign officials and other individuals who “censor Americans,” including those who target American technology companies, as the Trump administration steps up a confrontation with other countries over their social media policies.
title: US Announces Visa Curbs Targeting Social Media ‘Censorship’

author: Joao Lima
description: Portuguese President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa will hold meetings with parties on Thursday after the May 18 election vote count was concluded.
title: Portugal President to Meet Parties Before Naming Prime Minister

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Steven T. Dennis looks at some of the Republican dissent over the tax and spending bill passed by the House . Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Musk Joined by Some Senate Republicans Bemoaning Tax Bill’s Red Ink

author: Manuela Tobias
description: After denouncing it as a propaganda tool for the left, Argentina’s libertarian President Javier Milei is relaunching a state-run TV channel for kids set to feature a cartoon teaching free market economics while stressing the evils of taxes and communism.
title: Milei Gets Tuttle Twins to Teach Free Markets to Argentine Kids

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth ordered staff cuts at the congressionally mandated Pentagon office that oversees tests of major weapons systems, to ensure they’re effective and maintainable, before billions of dollars are spent on them.
title: Hegseth Cuts Staff at Pentagon’s Independent Test Office

description: Pekín quiere una economía de alta tecnología basada en el suministro interno, aunque el costo sea alto
title: La ciudad china del litio resiste la caída de precios por la autosuficiencia que exige Pekín

author: Jessica Nix, Kelsey Butler
description: Since the US Supreme Court in 2022 overturned its Roe v. Wade decision establishing a nationwide right to an abortion, the fight over the intervention has focused largely on a pill that ends pregnancies: mifepristone. The court in June 2024 preserved the current level of access to medication abortion, the most common way to terminate a pregnancy in the country. Still, many states limit access to mifepristone, efforts continue to curtail it further, and leaders in the US Department of Health and
title: Why the Abortion Pill Mifepristone Is Under Renewed Scrutiny in the US

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Germany’s new ruling coalition agreed to push ahead with measures aimed at stimulating the struggling economy and to enact as much legislation as possible before leaving for summer break in mid-July.
title: Merz Vows Legislative Action to Quickly Boost German Economy

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he would consider pardoning those connected to a plan to kidnap Michigan Democratic Governor Gretchen Whitmer.
title: Trump Weighs Pardons for Michigan Governor Kidnapping Plotters

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The Trump administration is telling immigration officials to ramp up arrests to 3,000 per day with a goal of more than 1 million a year, according to a person familiar with the discussions, a target that would significantly escalate the pace of detentions.
title: Trump Immigration Officials Set Target of 3,000 Arrests a Day

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump bristled at suggestions that Wall Street believed he was ultimately unwilling to follow through on extreme tariff threats, saying his repeated retreats were strategic efforts to exert trade concessions.
title: Trump Bristles at ‘TACO Trade’ That Bets On Him Backing Down

author: Gregory Korte
description: The White House will ask Congress next week to enact $9 billion of spending cuts into law — a small portion of the $175 billion in savings that Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency claims to have found.
title: Trump to Ask Congress to Codify DOGE Cuts, Hitting PBS and NPR

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US President Donald Trump said he warned Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu against a military strike against Iran that could disrupt efforts to broker a deal on Tehran’s nuclear program.
title: Trump Warned Netanyahu Iran Strike Would Be ‘Inappropriate’

author: Marissa Newman
description: Israel has deployed laser weapons during its ongoing war to deflect “scores” of aerial attacks, including from drones, the Defense Ministry said in a statement on Wednesday. This is the first time the country has acknowledged the use of directed-energy technologies in the battlefield.
title: Israel Acknowledges Use of Laser Weapons to Intercept Drones

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said Harvard University should cap foreign student enrollment at 15%, ratcheting up his effort to force policy changes at the elite institution.
title: Trump Says Harvard Should Cap Foreign Students at 15%

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said he’s holding off on new sanctions against Russia in order to preserve the chance for a deal with President Vladimir Putin to end the war in Ukraine.
title: US Pauses New Russia Sanctions to Keep Ukraine Deal Talks Alive, Trump Says

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump dismissed criticism from Elon Musk, his billionaire donor and adviser, over the cost of his signature tax bill, telling reporters on Wednesday that compromises were made to secure the necessary votes.
title: Trump Downplays Musk’s Tax Bill Criticism

author: Michael Nienaber
description: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization wants Germany to contribute as many as 40,000 more troops for the alliance’s defense against Russia, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: NATO Wants Germany to Provide 40,000 Additional Troops

author: Joe Mayes, Jamie Nimmo
description: The prospect of new support from the UK government for Nissan Motor Co. is the latest sign of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s push to protect Britain’s industrial base as he tries to stave off a political threat from Nigel Farage’s Reform party and preserve the Japanese automaker’s famous Sunderland plant.
title: UK’s Nissan Backing Shows Starmer’s Push to Save Industrial Jobs

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile’s government on Wednesday presented legislation that would allow women to interrupt early-term pregnancies, an attempt to fulfill a pledge by leftist President Gabriel Boric before he leaves office early next year.
title: Chile Government Unveils Bill That Would Fully Legalize Abortion

author: Fares Alghoul, Dan Williams
description: Israel said it killed the top commander of Hamas in Gaza, confirming reports from earlier this month.
title: Israel Says It Killed Mohammed Sinwar, Head of Hamas in Gaza

author: Daniel Hornak
description: Slovakia’s auto industry warned that Prime Minister Robert Fico’s government risks hurting a dominant sector in the country with tax increases and a geopolitical shift away from key trade partners.
title: Slovak Auto Industry Warns of Higher Taxes, Shift Away from EU

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Charlotte Hughes-Morgan
description: ASML Holding NV called on the Dutch government to ensure stable investment and fiscal policy, criticizing tax policy decisions that reduced benefits for foreign workers.
title: ASML Urges Consistency on Taxes After Dutch Government U-Turn

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland’s far-right leader Slawomir Mentzen said he would not endorse any of the two remaining presidential candidates ahead of a tightly-contested election slated for Sunday.
title: Polish Far-Right Leader Fails to Endorse Any Presidential Rival

author: Amanda Albright, Elizabeth Rembert
description: Elite American universities have secured over $4 billion in additional debt since March that will help protect their finances as the Trump administration takes aim at their budgets.
title: Elite Colleges Go on $4 Billion Debt Spree After Trump Threats

author: Konrad Krasuski
description: Poland’s nationalist candidate Karol Nawrocki has pledged to support the cryptocurrency industry if he wins a tightly-contested presidential election on Sunday.
title: Nationalist Candidate Backs Crypto in Tight Polish Presidential Race

author: Max Ramsay
description: The European Union’s trade chief, Maros Sefcovic, said he plans to speak to US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick and US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer on Thursday, as the EU has sought to fast-track negotiations to reach a deal ahead of a July 9 deadline.
title: EU Trade Chief to Speak to US Secretary Lutnick, Greer on Thursday

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Germany agreed to provide €5 billion in fresh military aid to Ukraine, the Defense Ministry in Berlin said in a statement on Wednesday.
title: Germany Agrees on €5 Billion in Fresh Military Aid to Ukraine

author: Ethan Bronner
description: The foundation backed by Israel and the US to hand out aid in Gaza said it’s operating for a second day, and denied reports of deaths and casualties when Palestinians overran a distribution site on Tuesday.
title: Israel-backed Group Says Gaza Aid Being Delivered, Denies Deaths

author: Michael Nienaber, Olesia Safronova
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz announced Germany will work with Ukraine to produce long-range weapons, intensifying cooperation with the war-battered nation as European allies pile pressure on Russia to engage in talks to end the war.
title: Germany to Help Kyiv Build Long-Range Missiles to Hit Russia

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: After pledging a free-floating currency a month ago, Argentina’s government has intervened in the market to influence the peso’s value, a move that stands in sharp contrast to its commitments to the International Monetary Fund.
title: Milei Intervenes in Currency Market Despite Letting Argentine Peso Float

author: Julian Lee
description: Moscow’s crude export prices slipped for a seventh straight week
title: Falling Russian Oil Prices Drive Exports’ Value to Two-Year Low

author: Ben Westcott, James Mayger
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is confronting a fresh diplomatic dilemma with China: How to fulfill a pledge to regain control of a strategic port without jeopardizing improved relations with his country’s largest trading partner.
title: Australia Looks to Avoid a Panama Repeat in China Port Showdown

author: Greg Ryan
description: Boston is pressuring Harvard University and other local colleges to funnel millions more into the city’s tax coffers, a push that’s becoming increasingly complicated as the Trump administration intensifies its attacks on higher education.
title: Boston Pushes Harvard, Other Colleges for Money Even as Trump Steps Up Attacks

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Andrea Palasciano, Daniel Basteiro, Jasmina Kuzmanovic
description: NATO proposed including expenditures on cybersecurity and activities related to border and coastal security to qualify for the military alliance’s new defense-related spending target of 1.5% of GDP.
title: NATO Floats Cybersecurity to Be Included in New Spending Target

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Zelenskiy Embarks on a Key Month for Ukraine

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union wants to create a maritime security hub in the Black Sea to monitor potential threats and protect critical infrastructure, Kaja Kallas, the EU’s top diplomat, told reporters on Wednesday.
title: EU Plans to Create a Maritime Security Hub in the Black Sea

author: Kati Pohjanpalo
description: Finland started the process of withdrawing from the Ottawa Convention, which bans anti-personnel landmines.
title: Finland Starts Process to Withdraw From Landmine Ban Treaty

author: Maya Averbuch, Alex Vasquez
description: It’s an election unlike any other in Mexico. No sports stadiums packed with the party faithful. The smiling faces of normally omnipresent candidates almost completely absent on TV or glitzy posters. But the stakes couldn’t be higher.
title: Mexico’s Judicial Reform Is Now In the Hands of Confused Voters

author: Toru Fujioka
description: The Bank of Japan amassed the largest amount of unrealized losses on record from its government bond holdings in the year ended March, highlighting the challenges it faces in unwinding more than a decade of extraordinary monetary easing.
title: BOJ’s Bond Holding Paper Losses Hit Record After Rate Hikes

author: Alastair Gale, Erica Yokoyama
description: President Donald Trump’s pivot to champion Nippon Steel Corp.’s bid to buy US Steel Corp. raises the prospect of fresh positive momentum for Japan’s sluggish negotiations with the US over tariff relief.
title: Trump’s Nippon Steel Bid Support Boosts Japan’s Trade Talk Hopes

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea’s presidential frontrunner Lee Jae-myung increased his lead over ruling party nominee Kim Moon-soo, according to the latest opinion poll, another sign that he is well placed to triumph in next week’s election if the conservative vote remains split.
title: South Korea’s Lee Sees Lead Grow in Opinion Poll as Vote Looms

author: Maya Averbuch, Alex Vasquez
description: Elecciones sin precedentes: el domingo, los mexicanos elegirán a sus ministros y jueces
title: La Justicia en México pende de unos cuantos votantes confundidos

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thai and Cambodian soldiers exchanged fire at a disputed border area early on Wednesday, prompting the two sides to hold talks to end the standoff.
title: Thai, Cambodian Soldiers Exchange Fire at Disputed Border Area

author: Arsalan Shahla
description: Iran will consider allowing the International Atomic Energy Agency to send American inspectors to monitor the Islamic Republic’s atomic activity, if it manages to broker a deal with Washington.
title: Iran Says IAEA May Send US Inspectors if Nuclear Deal is Reached

author: Josh Xiao
description: China can boost production of high-end technological goods without undermining its push to lift domestic consumption, economist Keyu Jin said.
title: China Tech Ambitions Won’t Hurt Consumption Pivot, Keyu Jin Says

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Volodymyr Verbianyi
description: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called on western allies to provide about $30 billion by the end of the year to boost domestic weapons production and hold off Russia’s advance.
title: Ukraine Needs $30 Billion to Boost Arms Output, Zelenskiy Says

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesia is ready to open diplomatic ties with Israel if it recognizes Palestine as an independent state, President Prabowo Subianto said after a meeting with his French counterpart on Wednesday.
title: Indonesia Open to Israel Ties if It Recognizes Palestine

author: Alastair Gale, Soo-Hyang Choi
description: A win for the left-of-center frontrunner in South Korea’s presidential election would likely herald more caution by Seoul over taking sides in US-China rivalry, a new effort to draw North Korea into dialogue and the potential for tension with Japan.
title: South Korea Set to Balance US, China Ties More If Lee Wins Vote

author: Lucille Liu
description: European firms in China are the most pessimistic about growth prospects since 2011, a new survey shows, underscoring the challenges of doing business in the world’s second-largest economy despite recent government efforts to address some complaints.
title: Pessimism Swells on Doing Business in China, European Firms Say

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysia’s Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli said he is resigning from the cabinet effective June 17, less than a week after he was defeated in the ruling party’s internal election.
title: Malaysia Economy Minister to Quit After Defeat in Party Poll

description: BANGKOK (AP) — Thai and Cambodian soldiers briefly fired at each other in their disputed border area Wednesday, the Thai and Cambodian armies said.
title: Thai and Cambodian Soldiers Briefly Clash in Disputed Border Area

author: Ben Westcott
description: Australia’s center-right Liberal and National opposition parties have reassembled into a formal coalition, about a week after ending their decades-long alliance in the wake of a devastating national election loss.
title: Australia’s Center-Right Opposition Regroups About One Week After Split

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesia’s President Prabowo Subianto and France’s President Emmanuel Macron are poised to sign a letter of intent to strengthen a defense partnership that has already led to the Southeast Asian nation purchasing billions of dollars’ worth of French weaponry.
title: Indonesia, France Set to Sign Defense Letter During Macron Visit

author: Agnieszka Barteczko, Maciej Martewicz
description: Donald Tusk’s government needs to keep businesses onside, and many want to see faster action on energy, bureaucracy and taxation.
title: Poland Exposes Cracks in Its Booming Economy Before Crunch Vote

author: Marc Champion
description: The Kremlin’s recent escalation escalation is logical and, without a Trump U-turn, likely to succeed.
title: Dismissing Putin as Crazy Is Deluded and Dangerous

author: Lucy White
description: Nigel Farage made a clear attempt to win over Labour’s core working-class voters by calling for expanding welfare payments and cutting taxes. What was far less clear: How the Reform UK leader would pay for it without busting Britain’s budget.
title: Farage Keeps Finances Vague in UK Welfare Plan Targeting Labour

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Germany plans to introduce legislation to abolish a fast-track option that allows well-integrated migrants to naturalize after three years in the country. The move is part of a wider effort by new conservative leader Friedrich Merz to make Europe’s largest economy less attractive to foreigners.
title: Germany Prepares to Abolish Its Fast-Track Path to Citizenship

author: John Harney
description: Elon Musk expressed dissatisfaction with President Donald Trump’s giant tax bill, which the US House narrowly passed last week, saying it undercut his efforts to slash government spending.
title: Musk Says He’s ‘Disappointed’ That Trump Tax Bill Raises Deficit
